actions.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5620 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived. The bill shall be considered as read through page 21, line 11, and shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule for a period not to exceed two hours. Bill is open to amendments. Within the two hour period, debate on title III of the bill and any amendments thereto may not exceed 30 minutes. If such two hour period is exhausted, the disposition of any questions then pending and the reading of the last two lines of the bill shall constitute the conclusion of the bill for amendment.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-707, by Mr. Bonior.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 178.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 207 - 199 (Roll No. 323).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 174 (Roll no. 324).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5620) making supplemental appropriations, transfers, and rescissions for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5620 (supplemental appropriations).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5620) making supplemental appropriations, transfers, and rescissions for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
